content.title: Intro
content.content:
1983
Preceded by
1983
1984
Year
1985
Followed by
1985

Tolkien-related events that took place in 1984.

content.title: February
content.content:
24 - The Book of Lost Tales Part One, the first book of The History of Middle-earth, is published in the US.
27 - Michael Tolkien, J.R.R. Tolkien's second son, dies.
? - Fantasists on Fantasy: A Collection of Critical Reflections by Eighteen Masters of the Art, including two works by J.R.R. Tolkien, is published.

content.title: April
content.content:
1 - The Monsters and the Critics is published in the US.
18 - Francis de Wolff, who voiced Smaug in the 1968 radio series of The Hobbit, dies.
? - Bree and the Barrow-Downs is published.

content.title: June
content.content:
1 - Moria: The Dwarven City is published.
6 - Ã…ke Ohlmarks, Swedish translator, dies.
? - Mallorn 21 is published.

content.title: August
content.content:
10-13 - Mythcon 15.
16 - The Book of Lost Tales: Part Two is published in the UK.

content.title: November
content.content:
26 - The Book of Lost Tales Part Two is published in the US.
? - Amon Hen 70 is published.

? - Johan de Meij begins work on his Symphony No. 1 "The Lord of the Rings"
? - Jane Johnson becomes Publisher of the Tolkien list at Allen and Unwin, Unwin Hyman and HarperCollins.
? - Rangers of the North (book) is published.
? - Dagorlad and the Dead Marshes is published.
? - The Tower of Cirith Ungol and Shelob's Lair is published.
? - Hillmen of the Trollshaws is published.
? - The Manuscripts of J.R.R.T. is issued.
? - Beyond Bree 1985 Tolkien Calendar is released.
? - Tolkien Calendar 1985 is released.
? - The 1985 J.R.R. Tolkien Calendar is released.
Years
1981 1982 1983 1984 1985 1986 1987
